Ok, do you know what the internal combustion engine is?

Yes, I am familiar with the internal combustion engine. It is a type of engine that generates power by burning fuel, typically gasoline or diesel, inside a combustion chamber within the engine. This creates a high-pressure and high-temperature gas, which then expands and pushes a piston, generating mechanical energy that can be used to power vehicles, machinery, and other devices.
Exactly. And do you know what silly putty is?

Yes, I am familiar with Silly Putty. It is a type of toy putty that is often sold in small plastic eggs. Silly Putty has a unique property where it can be stretched, molded, and shaped like a solid, but it also has some characteristics of a liquid, such as flowing slowly over time. It was first introduced in 1949 and has been a popular toy ever since.
